subtitle: Firm, ripe summer fruit are set into an orange juice jelly.

method.text: Prepare the fruit by removing the stalks.
Pour 150 ml of the orange juice into a basin. Sprinkle the gelatine over. Allow to stand for 2-3 min. Then dissolve over a pan of hot water or in the microwave for 2-3 min.

Blend the gelatine with the rest of the orange juice. Pour a little into the bottom of a 1 <sup>1</sup>/<sub>2</sub> litre loaf tin or mould. Allow to set slightly, keeping the rest of the orange jelly at room temperature.

Spoon a layer of fruit over the jelly. Carefully cover with more liquid jelly. Allow this layer to set. Then continue like that until you have two or three layers of fruit, saving enough orange jelly for a final covering.
Leave to set in the fridge until firm.
When firm, turn out of the tin. Decorate with mint leaves and orange slices. Serve in slices.

title: Summer terrine
